scenarios.action: There has been a sharp increase in mass shootings across the country. What do you do?

options.reaction: Implement stricter background checks
Increase funding for mental health services
Require armed guards in schools and other public spaces
Ban all weapons developed later than the Constitution
Increase funding for police departments
Encourage citizens to arm themselves for self-defense
Legalize bump stocks at the "recommendation" of the NRA

scenarios.action: After the Olympics, you invite Team USA for dinner at the White House. What do you serve them?

options.reaction: McDonald's
Performance-enhancing drugs
Filet mignon & caviar
Whey Protein Powder
Five Guys
Your mom's "famous" casserole

scenarios.action: A large corporation, considered to be "too big to fail", is on the brink of bankruptcy. What do you do?

options.reaction: Provide a government bailout
Let the free market handle it
Nationalize the corporation
Impose strong oversight over their corporate restructuring
Provide aid to affected workers and communities

scenarios.action: A powerful drug cartel has been found to be trafficking large quantities of illegal drugs into the US. What do you do?

options.reaction: Increase funding and resources for border security
Work with Interpol to disrupt the cartel's operations
Increase penalties for drug offenses
Offer witness protection to any cartel members who snitch
Send the military to wipe out the cartel

scenarios.action: The International Olympic Committee has offered the United States the opportunity to host the Olympics. What do you do?

options.reaction: Pursue the bid and invest in necessary infrastructure
Decline the opportunity due to financial concerns
Quietly bribe officials to secure the bid
Place your bid after negotiating for more "benefits" from the IOC
Partner with private companies to fund your bid

scenarios.action: The Interstate Highway System is in dire need of major structural renovations to ensure safety and reliability. What do you do?

options.reaction: Increase funding for regular maintenance and repairs
Raise taxes to fund major renovations
Implement tolls on the freeways to fund renovations
Privatize the freeway system
Invest in new technology to make the system more efficient

scenarios.action: A crash in the housing market has led to widespread foreclosures and declining property values. What do you do?

options.reaction: Implement a government-funded mortgage relief program
Increase interest rates to stabilize the market
Provide tax incentives for home buyers
Increase funding for affordable housing programs
Allow large financial institutions to fail and let the market handle it
Implement stricter regulations on lending practices
Encourage foreign investment in the housing market

scenarios.action: A major cryptocurrency exchange, which has been misusing its customers' investments, has gone bankrupt. What do you do?

options.reaction: Implement stricter regulations on cryptocurrency exchanges
Locate, then arrest the executives and put them on trial
Provide government aid to affected customers
Increase the penalties for fraud

scenarios.action: The military industry is strongly lobbying for a war with a neighboring country, citing economic benefits. What do you do?

options.reaction: Declare war and support the military industry
Ignore the lobbying and make a decision based on national security
Investigate the lobbying and potential conflicts of interest
Increase transparency and regulations on lobbying

scenarios.action: The country is considering creating a new federal holiday to honor an important figure in American history. Who should be honored?

options.reaction: President Ronald Reagan
Harriet Tubman
Susan B. Anthony
President Abraham Lincoln
Senator John McCain
Governor Sarah Palin
Ronald McDonald
Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger
Malcom X
President Barack Obama

scenarios.action: An oil rig explodes in the Gulf of Mexico, causing a massive oil spill off the coast of the U.S. What do you do?

options.reaction: Use federal resources to contain and clean up the oil spill
Make the oil company clean it up, bankrupting them
Increase regulations on offshore drilling
Dump an industrial quantity of Dawn dishsoap onto the spill
Do nothing about the spill
Work with neighboring countries to clean up

scenarios.action: 3D printing technology has allowed for the popularization of homemade firearms, also known as "ghost guns". How do you react?

options.reaction: The right of the people to keep and bear Arms shall not be infringed
Require all DIY firearms to be registered with the government
Ban 3D printing technology
Implement a buy-back program for 3D printed guns
Criminalize the use of homemade firearms

scenarios.action: Catastrophic flooding has occurred in a major American agricultural center, causing widespread damage to crops and infrastructure. What do you do?

options.reaction: Provide emergency aid to those displaced by the flood
Invest in infrastructure projects to prevent future flooding
Import food to replace lost crops
Provide financial assistance to affected farmers and businesses
Get insurance companies to cover damages

scenarios.action: The U.S. is facing a shortage of skilled workers in certain industries, causing difficulties for many businesses. What do you do?

options.reaction: Provide colleges with funding to train more students
Increase the number of visas granted to foreign workers
Invest in A.I. to replace human workers
Encourage businesses to invest in retraining current employees
Encourage overseas outsourcing of work

scenarios.action: The semiconductor (computer chip) industry is facing a supply chain shortage, causing production delays and increased costs for businesses. What do you do?

options.reaction: Invest in U.S. chip manufacturing
Offer tax incentives to U.S. chipmakers
Invade a country with robust chipmaking infrastructure
Let the free market balance itself
Pressure other countries to increase supply

scenarios.action: Big Tech is being investigated for alleged anticompetitive practices. What do you do?

options.reaction: Implement GDPR-style regulations on data protection
Offer tax incentives to smaller tech companies
Cancel the investigation at the request of tech lobbyists
Implement stricter acquisition regulations
Leverage the investigation to get Big Tech to help you develop a social credit system

scenarios.action: Government researchers have discovered a cure for a major disease that affects millions of people worldwide. What do you do?

options.reaction: Publish the discovery for free
License the technology to American pharmaceutical companies
Classify the findings to protect the healthcare industry
Use the cure as a bargaining chip in international negotiations

scenarios.action: A major cyber attack has been launched against the United States, targeting critical infrastructure. What do you do?

options.reaction: Increase funding for cybersecurity
Launch a counter-attack
Increase cybersecurity regulations on critical businesses
Claim that Windows XP is "good enough"

scenarios.action: Scientists have discovered that a major volcanic eruption could occur in the next ten years in the United States. What do you do?

options.reaction: Develop technology to safely harness volcanos' energy
Increase funding for volcano monitoring and early warning systems
Force residents near volcanos to move to a safer area
Prepare a disaster relief plan for when a volcano erupts
Force insurance companies to insure at-risk customers

scenarios.action: A model of passenger jet has been involved in multiple major crashes, with FAA investigations revealing a design flaw as the cause. What do you do?

options.reaction: Ground all flights of the affected model and order a recall
Increase FAA funding for aircraft safety investigations
Increase safety regulations on airplane manufacturers
Investigate the engineers responsible for the flaw
